medical_history.chief_complaint: Decreased visual acuity in the left eye and diplopia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 7 weeks before admission with a moderate frontal headache on the left side, which resolved after several hours. The next morning, the left side of her face was numb from lower eyelid to mouth and from nose to ear. Numbness persisted in the middle of the face for 2 weeks before resolving, after which ptosis and diplopia developed. The patient experienced periorbital pain for 2 weeks prior to admission, with nausea and vomiting occurring 3 days before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism, chronic rhinosinusitis, environmental allergies to mold and dust, herpes zoster involving the trigeminal nerve (resolved), and excision of a breast fibroadenoma.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandfather had lymphoma; other family history was not known.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with husband and children, works from home, drinks alcohol occasionally, does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
